main.name: Jeff Cao
main.description: I have experience in asset management, software engineering, and machine learning.
main.bio: In my gap year after high school, I travelled across Asia and worked for Beijing and Shenzhen-based startups - in both product design and mobile and web platform roles. I have a background in economics, statistics, machine learning, and computer systems. I graduated cum laude with degrees in Computer Science and Economics (Data Science Spec.) from the University of Chicago. My other interests include rock climbing, tennis, cooking, and movies.
main.contactmessage: Here is where you should write your message to readers to have them get in contact with you.

resume.skillmessage: Here you can create a short write-up of your skills to show off to employers

education.degree: (Cum Laude) B.S. Computer Science, B.A. Economics with Specialization in Data Science
education.description: At UChicago, I was the President of [Maroon Capital](https://mc.uchicago.edu), and the Tech Platform Director of the [UChicago Trading Competition](https://tradingcompetition.uchicago.edu/). I was also on the board of the UChicago Investing Forum.
At Milton, I was a Cofounder of the Milton Filmmaking Club, which produced two films for the All American High School Filmmaking Festival.

work.title: Analyst - Portfolio Solutions Group
work.description: Producing thought leadership for clients in the form of custom macro-sensitivity and asset returns analyses and publishing [research papers](https://www.aqr.com/Insights/Research/Alternative-Thinking) on topics such as macroeconomic trends, factor investing, and asset allocation.

work.title: Software Developer & Risk Mgmt. Intern
work.description: Built futures & options risk calculation tools using Python, VBA, SQL. Used Pandas to process client portfolio data into dashboard metrics that allows easy detection of outliers and potential at-risk clients. Analyzed Interest Rate Swap data to inform on trading costs and risk margins for major clients, and to update models for client default simulations.

work.title: Quantitative Trading & Software Intern
work.description: Developed trading systems (statistical arbitrage, macroeconomic trends) across commodity futures markets. Utilized regression models such as OLS, vector autoregression, Kalman filter, and other state space models.

work.title: Chief Technology Officer
work.company_bio: Beijing-based Startup in On-Demand Professional Photography
work.description: Co-founded Shangjing, built and managed a team of engineers for the design and production of the mobile app, working with design, project management, product deployment, user testing, etc.

work.title: Front-end Software Developer
work.company_bio: Leading national Chinese Chess/Go/Checkers/etc. Competitive Tournament platform
work.description: Developed the front-end of the live online chess tournament website using React.js, GraphQL and TypeScript. Built live streaming for website’s current live national chess tournament streaming.

work.title: Software Development Intern, ML Research
work.company_bio: Shenzhen-based Financial Services and mobile investing company
work.description: Built/deployed natural language processing (convolutional neural networks) models to conduct sentiment analysis of financial news articles, which is now used to give sentiment ratings in the smart web/iOS mobile investment app. Also developed the iOS app financial charting and trading indicators.

publications.title: Desire Path-Inspired Procedural Placement of Coins in a Platformer Game.
publications.description: Proceedings of the Experimental AI in Games Workshop (2018).

projects.title: UCEvents
projects.category: An event platform for UChicago students, submitted to Uncommon Hacks 2020 Hackathon

projects.title: Instagram Colors
projects.category: Model for correlating Instagram post image styles and colors with number of likes and other meta-data

projects.title: BTC reddit
projects.category: Correlating the erratic changes in Bitcoin’s price with sentiments expressed on reddit

projects.title: Autoencoder Style Transfer
projects.category: Generalized autoencoder style transfer using Feed-Forward neural networks

testimonials.text: Here you should write some nice things that someone has said about you. No lies though, employers can tell when you are lying.

That Tim Baker must be one of the most brilliant developers I've ever met! It is amazing that nobody has hired him yet. Hey you, you should hire this guy, he may be fresh out of University and have zero on the job experience but I am confident that he will be one of your best developers in no time!
